task_summary: Robot perceives a T-shaped block and a fixed goal region, approaches, then executes two orthogonal push strokes (0째 then 90째) to seat the block into the target before retreating.
assumptions: friction sufficient to move the block without slipping excessively
workspace is collision-free in planned push directions

node_specs.description: Write a string value to the blackboard.
Checks if the specified target is visible.
Active visual search using a predefined scan pattern.
Run perception to localize a symbolic target.
Move the end-effector to a symbolic pose within a time limit.
Verify the robot is at the given symbolic target pose.
Approach the object and align the TCP with the planned push contact.
Set the tool yaw to one of the discrete allowed angles.
Apply a straight-line push on the target for a set distance and direction.
Back off from the workspace after task completion.

failure_modes: push direction blocked or causes rotation
recovery_strategy: fallback to ScanForTarget if visibility fails
re-run ApproachAndAlign if contact pose deviates
repeat the second push if final alignment is off

expected_success_criteria: centroid of t_block within goal_region and orientation consistent with outline
